result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher R Cummings

defendant.name: Cummings, Christopher R
defendant.address: 5200 North Lovers Lane Road, #3, Milwaukee, WI 53225

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher R Cummings in court.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared on behalf of Katie Seelow by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Status of Counsel held.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel at this time.  Court continues to find GOOD CAUSE to toll time limits of preliminary hearing.  Defendant requests Court to address no contact order modification.  Court will adjourn case for Order to Show Cause hearing and bail review hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Christopher R Cummings in court.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Court addressed no contact order.  Defendant to have no contact with JOB (01/16/2014) and FMC (06/02/2016), and co-defendant Melodie Bell.  The Public defenders office has not appointed counsel at this time.  Court will adjourn case for status of counsel.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JOB (01/16/2014) and FMC (06/02/2016), and co-defendant Melodie Bell
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Christopher R Cummings in court in person.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Court orders defendant to continue to comply with Justice Point conditions.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered an Oral No Contact Order with Co-Defendant Melodie Bell

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Christopher R Cummings appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Christopher R Cummings.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Defense motions to dismiss due to lack of probable cause within the four corners of the criminal complaint. Motion is denied. Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
